security_score.summary: DroidSec identified 53 security findings (2 critical, 25 high, 11 medium severity), resulting in a security score of 24/100 (Grade F). This application has severe security issues and should NOT be released without remediation.

findings.name: Application is Debuggable
findings.description: The application is set as debuggable. Attackers can attach a debugger, inspect memory, and modify runtime behavior.
findings.remediation: Set android:debuggable='false' in release builds. Ensure build.gradle sets debuggable=false for release.

findings.name: Hardcoded Password
findings.description: Hardcoded password found in source code. Easily extractable by decompiling the APK.
findings.remediation: Never hardcode passwords. Use Android Keystore for storing secrets. Implement proper authentication flows.

findings.name: Exported ContentProvider With Weak Permission Model
findings.evidence: android:exported="true" (or implied via intent-filter) with no permission requirement
findings.description: Provider 'com.android.insecurebankv2.TrackUserContentProvider' is exported without android:permission/readPermission/writePermission. This can expose app data over content:// URIs to other apps. No grant-uri-permission scoping was detected.
findings.remediation: Set android:exported='false' unless cross-app sharing is required. If sharing is required, enforce readPermission/writePermission (prefer signature-level) and narrowly scope URI grants.

findings.name: Sensitive Data in Logs
findings.description: Sensitive data may be written to system logs. Logs are accessible to other apps on older Android versions.
findings.remediation: Never log sensitive data. Use ProGuard/R8 to strip Log calls from release builds.

findings.name: WebView Loading User-Controlled URL
findings.description: WebView loads a URL from a variable, potentially user-controlled. Can lead to loading malicious content.
findings.remediation: Validate and sanitize all URLs before loading in WebView. Use an allowlist of trusted domains.

findings.name: Critical Permission: SEND_SMS
findings.description: App can send SMS messages. Can send premium SMS or phishing messages.
findings.remediation: Review if this permission is truly needed. Request at runtime and explain to users why it's required.

findings.name: High-Entropy String: Base64-Encoded Secret
findings.description: Shannon entropy: 5.36 bits/char. Base64-Encoded Secret detected. High-entropy strings in source code often indicate hardcoded secrets, API keys, or cryptographic material that should be stored securely.
findings.remediation: Move secrets to Android Keystore, environment variables, or a secure vault. Never hardcode secrets in source code.

findings.name: High-Entropy String: Base64-Encoded Secret
findings.description: Shannon entropy: 5.27 bits/char. Base64-Encoded Secret detected. High-entropy strings in source code often indicate hardcoded secrets, API keys, or cryptographic material that should be stored securely.
findings.remediation: Move secrets to Android Keystore, environment variables, or a secure vault. Never hardcode secrets in source code.

findings.name: High-Entropy String: Potential Secret/Token
findings.description: Shannon entropy: 5.22 bits/char. Potential Secret/Token detected. High-entropy strings in source code often indicate hardcoded secrets, API keys, or cryptographic material that should be stored securely.
findings.remediation: Move secrets to Android Keystore, environment variables, or a secure vault. Never hardcode secrets in source code.

findings.name: High-Entropy String: Potential Secret/Token
findings.description: Shannon entropy: 5.18 bits/char. Potential Secret/Token detected. High-entropy strings in source code often indicate hardcoded secrets, API keys, or cryptographic material that should be stored securely.
findings.remediation: Move secrets to Android Keystore, environment variables, or a secure vault. Never hardcode secrets in source code.

findings.name: High-Entropy String: Potential Secret/Token
findings.description: Shannon entropy: 5.18 bits/char. Potential Secret/Token detected. High-entropy strings in source code often indicate hardcoded secrets, API keys, or cryptographic material that should be stored securely.
findings.remediation: Move secrets to Android Keystore, environment variables, or a secure vault. Never hardcode secrets in source code.

findings.name: High-Entropy String: Base64-Encoded Secret (and 15 more)
findings.description: Found 20 total instances of this vulnerability. Only the first 5 are shown in detail above.
findings.remediation: Move secrets to Android Keystore, environment variables, or a secure vault. Never hardcode secrets in source code.

findings.name: Exported Broadcast Receiver Without Sender Permission Guard
findings.evidence: exported receiver without android:permission; custom actions=theBroadcast; sensitive behavior in com/android/insecurebankv2/MyBroadCastReceiver.java:21 (SharedPreferences)
findings.description: Receiver is externally reachable and appears to process potentially sensitive operations without sender permission checks.
findings.remediation: Set android:exported='false' if external access is unnecessary, or enforce signature-level android:permission and validate sender identity.

findings.name: Low Minimum SDK Version
findings.description: App supports Android API 15 which lacks many security features introduced in later versions.
findings.remediation: Increase minSdkVersion to at least 21 (Android 5.0) to benefit from modern security features.

findings.name: Application Data Backup Allowed
findings.description: ADB backup is enabled. An attacker with physical access can extract application data via 'adb backup'.
findings.remediation: Set android:allowBackup='false' in AndroidManifest.xml, or implement BackupAgent to exclude sensitive data.

findings.name: Unencrypted SQLite Database
findings.description: SQLite database used without encryption. On rooted devices, database files can be read directly.
findings.remediation: Use SQLCipher or Android's EncryptedFile API to encrypt the database.

findings.name: External Storage Usage
findings.description: Application writes to external storage. Files on external storage are world-readable on older Android versions.
findings.remediation: Use internal storage (getFilesDir()) for sensitive data. If external storage is required, encrypt the data first.

findings.name: External Storage Usage
findings.description: Application writes to external storage. Files on external storage are world-readable on older Android versions.
findings.remediation: Use internal storage (getFilesDir()) for sensitive data. If external storage is required, encrypt the data first.

findings.name: JavaScript Enabled in WebView
findings.description: JavaScript enabled in WebView. If loading untrusted content, this can lead to XSS attacks.
findings.remediation: Only enable JavaScript if absolutely necessary. Validate all URLs loaded in the WebView.

findings.name: No Code Obfuscation Detected
findings.evidence: 0/9521 classes have short names (0% obfuscation ratio)
findings.description: The app does not appear to use ProGuard/R8 obfuscation. Note: This check may have false positives on decompiled (jadx) output. Best practice is to enable minification for release builds.
findings.remediation: Enable R8/ProGuard in build.gradle: minifyEnabled = true, and configure proguard-rules.pro.

findings.name: No SSL/TLS Certificate Pinning in Code
findings.evidence: No certificate pinning implementation found in source code
findings.description: The app does not implement certificate pinning in code. Without pinning, MITM attacks using rogue CA certificates can intercept all HTTPS traffic.
findings.remediation: Use OkHttp CertificatePinner or Android's network_security_config.xml with <pin-set> elements for your API domains.

findings.name: Dynamic Broadcast Receiver Without Permission Guard
findings.description: A dynamically registered receiver appears to accept custom broadcasts without a required sender permission, and the code handles sensitive actions.
findings.remediation: Use registerReceiver overloads with required permission and RECEIVER_NOT_EXPORTED where possible.

findings.name: Dynamic Broadcast Receiver Without Permission Guard
findings.description: A dynamically registered receiver appears to accept custom broadcasts without a required sender permission, and the code handles sensitive actions.
findings.remediation: Use registerReceiver overloads with required permission and RECEIVER_NOT_EXPORTED where possible.

findings.name: Dynamic Broadcast Receiver Without Permission Guard
findings.description: A dynamically registered receiver appears to accept custom broadcasts without a required sender permission, and the code handles sensitive actions.
findings.remediation: Use registerReceiver overloads with required permission and RECEIVER_NOT_EXPORTED where possible.

findings.name: Missing Network Security Configuration
findings.description: No custom network security configuration. App relies on platform defaults for certificate handling.
findings.remediation: Add a network_security_config.xml to explicitly control certificate pinning and cleartext behavior.

findings.name: Exported Activity Without Permission
findings.evidence: android:exported="true" (or implied via intent-filter) with no permission requirement
findings.description: The activity 'com.android.insecurebankv2.PostLogin' is exported and accessible by any app without permission. This may allow unauthorized access to internal functionality.
findings.remediation: Set android:exported='false' if external access is not needed, or add android:permission to restrict access.

findings.name: Exported Activity Without Permission
findings.evidence: android:exported="true" (or implied via intent-filter) with no permission requirement
findings.description: The activity 'com.android.insecurebankv2.DoTransfer' is exported and accessible by any app without permission. This may allow unauthorized access to internal functionality.
findings.remediation: Set android:exported='false' if external access is not needed, or add android:permission to restrict access.

findings.name: Exported Activity Without Permission
findings.evidence: android:exported="true" (or implied via intent-filter) with no permission requirement
findings.description: The activity 'com.android.insecurebankv2.ViewStatement' is exported and accessible by any app without permission. This may allow unauthorized access to internal functionality.
findings.remediation: Set android:exported='false' if external access is not needed, or add android:permission to restrict access.

findings.name: Exported Receiver Without Permission
findings.evidence: android:exported="true" (or implied via intent-filter) with no permission requirement
findings.description: The receiver 'com.android.insecurebankv2.MyBroadCastReceiver' is exported and accessible by any app without permission. This may allow unauthorized access to internal functionality.
findings.remediation: Set android:exported='false' if external access is not needed, or add android:permission to restrict access.

findings.name: 1 Additional Exported Activity(s)
findings.evidence: 4 total exported activitys without permission guards
findings.description: There are 4 total exported activity components without explicit permission guards. Only the first 3 are shown individually above.
findings.remediation: Review all exported components and restrict access where not needed.

findings.name: Dangerous Permissions Summary: 4 found
findings.evidence: 4 dangerous permissions requested out of 9 total
findings.description: The app requests 4 permissions classified as 'dangerous' by Android. Each requires runtime approval from the user. A high count may indicate over-privileged access but is common in feature-rich applications.
findings.remediation: Review each permission and remove those not essential to core functionality. Follow the principle of least privilege.

findings.name: Missing Network Security Configuration
findings.description: No network_security_config.xml found. Without this, the app relies on platform defaults which vary by Android version. Apps targeting SDK 28+ block cleartext by default, but older targets allow it.
findings.remediation: Create a network_security_config.xml that explicitly disables cleartext traffic and configures certificate pinning for your API endpoints.

findings.name: Exported Activity Without Intent Filter
findings.description: The activity com.android.insecurebankv2.PostLogin is exported without an intent filter. Any app can start this activity with an explicit intent, potentially bypassing authentication or accessing internal screens.
findings.remediation: Set android:exported="false" unless the activity needs to be accessible by other apps. If exported is needed, add a permission check.

findings.name: Exported Activity Without Intent Filter
findings.description: The activity com.android.insecurebankv2.DoTransfer is exported without an intent filter. Any app can start this activity with an explicit intent, potentially bypassing authentication or accessing internal screens.
findings.remediation: Set android:exported="false" unless the activity needs to be accessible by other apps. If exported is needed, add a permission check.

findings.name: Exported Activity Without Intent Filter
findings.description: The activity com.android.insecurebankv2.ViewStatement is exported without an intent filter. Any app can start this activity with an explicit intent, potentially bypassing authentication or accessing internal screens.
findings.remediation: Set android:exported="false" unless the activity needs to be accessible by other apps. If exported is needed, add a permission check.

findings.name: Exported Activity Without Intent Filter
findings.description: The activity com.android.insecurebankv2.ChangePassword is exported without an intent filter. Any app can start this activity with an explicit intent, potentially bypassing authentication or accessing internal screens.
findings.remediation: Set android:exported="false" unless the activity needs to be accessible by other apps. If exported is needed, add a permission check.

findings.name: Unprotected Broadcast Receiver
findings.evidence: Broadcast receiver with intent-filter but no permission guard
findings.description: The broadcast receiver com.android.insecurebankv2.MyBroadCastReceiver accepts intents from any app without requiring a permission. Malicious apps can send crafted intents to trigger unintended behavior.
findings.remediation: Add android:permission attribute to restrict which apps can send intents to this receiver, or set android:exported="false".

findings.name: Unprotected Broadcast Receiver
findings.evidence: Broadcast receiver with intent-filter but no permission guard
findings.description: The broadcast receiver com.google.android.gms.wallet.EnableWalletOptimizationReceiver accepts intents from any app without requiring a permission. Malicious apps can send crafted intents to trigger unintended behavior.
findings.remediation: Add android:permission attribute to restrict which apps can send intents to this receiver, or set android:exported="false".

findings.name: Root Detection Implemented
findings.evidence: Root detection patterns found in source
findings.description: The app implements root detection, which is a good security practice.
findings.remediation: Ensure root detection is robust and cannot be easily bypassed with tools like Frida or Xposed.
